rComments: Really horrible lecturer. Can't clearly explain anything. I felt unwelcomed during office hours. Material is not hard however she makes her tests way harder then they have to be. Discussions are mandatory. So much busy work. Ta Jordan was horrible. Overall, horrible and frustrating experience. Worst class I've taken at UCSC. Avoid Kay.

Professor Kay is extremely knowledgeable in her field, and interested in student learning outcomes. She provided us with excellent hands-on opportunities to put our knowledge into practice, and was always there with clear instructions to help us succeed.
I would try to take this class with someone else
Worst professor I've ever had. Sections are manditory and feel like an extra class. There is a lot of busy work that is unnecessary for understanding the course material.

If you love plants, Kathleen Kay's Botany class is amazing! The labs are fantastic, every week you get to learn the plant families by looking at live plants organized by family and spend time drawing them. Kathleen Kay is a very sincere person who cares a lot about doing a good job teaching. The exams were very fair.

Kathleen is a wonderful teacher. She is very sweet and helpful, and her lectures are clear and to the point. She really wants to see her students do their best possible, and is great at calming you down when you're a ball of stress. She answers questions politely, and responds to emails quickly. I want to take more of her classes, I adore her.

This class is excellent and extremely informative. It is hard and requires a lot of time. Project/readings were interesting. Kay herself is not the greatest lecturer but not the worst by far. She seems pretentious/not approachable but was very helpful and sweet in office hours. No curve, but tons of EC. Work hard and you'll be well rewarded.

She was an awful teacher and made me cry after almost every class. She assigns a ton of random work and has ridiculous guidelines that are really unclear. Whenever she started talking it made me have really bad anxiety, and she was always really condescending and disrespectful. Avoid taking this class with her!

doesn't seem to care about students, their progress, or their success.  does not explain grading/no rubrics for assignments. seems nice at first, but makes it difficult to succeed.  most of the time, she seems disinterested during lecture and responds to comments/questions in a rude manner.  would not recommend taking this class with her.
She seemed irritated most of the time and lectures were a bit boring. A friend warned me NOT to take this class with her. I should have took his advice.

iclicker, 1 midterm, 1 final, homework, section participation, writing #1,2, &3. The third one is the rewrite of writing assignment #1. Required to buy a program to do homework assignment.  Boring lectures but she had some good examples.

The lectures were read off the powerpoint slides, the exam questions were fair, but the amount of time she gave you for the final was only 1 hour and 30 minutes. Homework on the SimBio program were tedious... waste of time, I didn't learn anything.

Interesting subject matter, well presented overall although really quickly! She clearly knows her evolution, which includes evolving beyond any sympathy for undergraduates. One of the most condescending professors I have ever had. The writing assignments were tedious and dull and graded very hard. The class isn't too difficult if you study.

Overall a good class. Her examples can be really fascinating. The material changes the way you see all organisms (humans not excluded). Lack of transparency on test material and essay grading are probably my only complaints.
Poor class. teacher did not seem to fully understand material then expected students to know it. Also used extremely complicated examples for simple concepts.

Kathleen is a brand new and outstanding addition to the UCSC EEB Dept. I absolutely loved her Plant Systematics course & would highly recommend it / her to anyone willing to put in the time and effort to really learn something.
